description: Bobby loves stinky food! Feed him, but watch out – you never know when he’s going to BUUUURRRRP! Real lights and steam will burst from his mouth when he burps! The player with the most points after Bobby burps wins.

Finally, a way to make practicing phonics fun!

Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

Blah Blah Blah is a hilariously fun card game, perfect for kids who are just starting to learn to read. Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

How does Blah Blah Blah work?

Every card features a word consisting of three letters (or groups of letters). Each player takes seven cards. One card is placed face-up on the table with the rest of the deck in a pile, face-down. Players must play a card from their hand that contains at least one of the letters that are in the word on the table. The first player to get rid of all their cards wins. But beware! Wild cards hidden in the deck can force you to skip your turn or draw more cards.

—description from the publisher

Inspired by the game For the Queen, Donjons & Siphons (french for "Dungeons and Plumbing Traps"), is a card-based story-building game that you and up to five other players can begin playing in minutes. Choose your dungeon and use the prompt cards to collaboratively tell a story of love, conspiration, doubt, and hardships.

Donjons & Siphons will let you take on the fabulous roles of janitors in a dungeon, competing to become the Chief Janitor.
The game suggests 10 base characters (with different special powers and races). The players then take turns answering prompts from the Event deck. The cards of this deck have two questions: one for you and for your shift teammate (another player).
When the Event deck is empty, you'll have to vote for the best Chief (other than you). The game ends with the Chief's speech.

Some humans in a house, with other strange monsters called Trusis that every night kill someone.
Take your character and collaborate with your faction (humans, Trusis, aliens or castaway) to remain alive until the end. Talk, accuse others, defend yourself and use your powers to achieve your goal.

In Disci, you want to move your pieces across the board and into the opponent's starting zone before they can do the same. You can move pieces individually or jump over a piece to land on the empty space just past it. In doing so, however, you may not enter the large space in the center of the board. What's more, if you end up on a space marked with an "X", you must vacate this space in the next round, even moving backwards toward your starting area, if necessary.

The opponent cannot block you by leaving pieces in their starting zone as those spaces count as filled and will make it easier for you to win.

Can you read your opponent and emerge the better bettor? Are your horses the faster or slower runners versus your opponent's? Successfully bet on horse races to beat your opponent in a game that requires no shuffling and gives you access to your deck the entire game. Find out who the real thoroughbred is in this equestrian, mind-reading competition.

—description from the publisher

Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 2x2 version is the fastest-paced and easiest to learn.

—description from the publisher
To win, players will have to devise a strategy and choose the correct cards each round in order to eliminate the enemy's army.

Wield mighty waves and crushing sand to build your gateway to Atlantis before your opponent! Heavy strategy is required to outwit your opponent - choose to attack, fortify, or build - or combine different actions, and every choice determines what cards you draw; populate each bridge section with a war card to allow attacking your opponent's gate or to build your own; build abiding by the rules or fix any mistakes before you claim victory!

Build your bridge and your army while thwarting your opponent's. Learn some Greek to go along with some mythology as you march your army victorious through the gate to the fabled undersea kingdom!

—description from the publisher

Using only Diecast Toy Cars and 9 Print and Play cards, Drivers attempt to position their cars first place by the end of the race. Play occurs over an extremely limited number of card plays (less than 4 per lap/race) so each individual card play requires strategy and tactics.

Solo puzzle mode and three variant play modes are included in the original rules.

—description from the designer

Maratón Ligero ("Light Marathon"), is one of  versions of Maratón, a Mexican trivia game created by Sergio Schaar Chabat.  In this case, the questions, according to the text in the back of the box, are specialized in pop music, movie hits, sports and TV shows, contrary to the original one, who was more into general culture.

To play, a player rolls the dice and a judge reads a numered question in the front of the card, according to the dice points. After the player ansewers, the judge checks the back of the card to confirm. If the player was right, his token advances, if not, another player can doit. Is nobody knows it, then a black token called Ignorancia (Ignorance), advances.

The winner is the first player to reach the end line. If the Ignorance token does first, everybody loses.

Bon Appetit is a simple word game. Each alphabet has turned into a delicious cuisine, by using them to form a word, you will have a grant feast.
Bon Appetit!

—description from the publisher

What Do You Meme? but with the Photo Cards being from TikTok memes.

Each round, the judge chooses a Photo Card. Each of the other players chooses a Caption Card. The judge chooses which caption is funniest, and the player who chose that card gets a point.
Keep playing until you don't want anymore.

Construct your deck in an initial phase of secret bidding combined with drafting. Use your new cards and their special powers in a second round of secret biding to win victory points, but make sure not to use all your tricks before the final round because if you lose it your victory points will not count.

SiegKrone (means Victory Crown) is a trading card game published by famous Japanese SNS company GREE. The game contains a lot of mobile game ip and anime ip like attack on titan.

Like most tcgs, in this game, players should construct their own deck with 50 cards to fight with the opponent. Players play character cards to fight and use skill cards to help. Some character cards can evolution or awake. The player who causes 5 points of damage to the opposing player will win the game.

Galactic football from the Cosmic Kick series has moved to the game board. Together with Robert Lewandowski and the series characters, play the emotional football games full of tactical decisions. The dynamic 2-player gameplay will make you feel like you’re at Spaceball court - the Space Football Federation stadium.

—description from the publisher

Landsknecht is a set of rules for the Renaissance period, allowing players to recreate the battles of the Renaissance wars in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period. Between the heavy armour of the gendarmes and the structure of the early pike and shot formation, players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with cunning and bloody stubbornness.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Landsknecht aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and righteousness were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments and an option to wear over the top fashion was nether missed. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

While the oceans teem with endemic life, the terrestrial creatures of the Galapagos are threatened by invasive species.

In Pocket Galapagos, you will manage the indigenous animals of a lone island in the chain known for its ecological diversity, while minimizing the effects of threats caused by new species. Bolster the populations of land and sea using multi-use cards, potential combos, and a bit of press your luck in this solo player card game.

The front of each card features one of three endemic populations (Rice Rat, Carpenter Ant, or Giant Ground Finch) as well as one of nine Aquatic Species.  The back of each card features a Rat, Bird, or Ant, as well as an Invasive Effect.

Each turn, the player reveals five cards from the deck.  Two cards are played to The Ocean to increase populations and gain abilities (with clever card play allowing for multiple actions and effects based on the cards chosen and their order of play).  While two cards are then flipped and played to either the Island Biome or Dominant Species (which have limited capacity) or to the Invasive Species.  Any remaining cards are discarded for Invasive Effects.

Players score points for the cards they play, depending on how they're played, and if they make it to the 10th turn, they may win.  However, the player loses the game at the end of any turn in which two or more populations are at zero and/or there are three or more of the same species in the Invasive Species.

-description from designer

It's opening night at The Coffin Door, the nightclub run by celebrity vampire Vlad Fanger.  Vlad is the vampire all the other vampires want to be and mortal wannabes wannabe bitten by.  But his body was just discovered in the VIP section.  Now He's not the Undead, he's just dead.

Killer Party is a series of Social Mystery Party Games for adults.  Do crazy stunts and challenges to earn clues.  Get points for scratching off the right answers.  Score the most points to solve the murder.

Includes: 3 killer envelopes with introduction sheets, 12 clue cards, 12 scratch-off investigation cards, 1 killer conclusion envelope.

'Good Old Hook Nose is a set of rules for the Napoleonic period, allowing players to recreate Napoleonic battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Officers of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger. The name comes from the affectionate nickname given to Wellington by his troops.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Good Old Hook Nose aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where uniform, discipline and control were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

An Uncivil Affair is a set of rules for the English Civil wars period, allowing players to recreate the ebb and flow of the battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period.

Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger, recreating the lines of pike and shot, as well as the sweeping cavalry popular in this period, with little or no control of the outcome.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

An Uncivil Affair aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and religious piety were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

Flames in the South is a set of rules for the American Civil War, allowing players to recreate the open warfare and firepower of the ACW in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Officers of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with sweat and tears, as brother fights brother.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Flames in the South aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the war, where loyalty to your state and family were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

Have you heard of Brigit, a New Zealand cat known for stealing drying underwear? Did you know that the most famous newspaper from Norway published the official death notice of Santa Claus? That CIA agents send each other messages with their shoelaces? Don't you worry — neither will your friends!

In each round of Fake That!, the player in the role of "Gullible" will ask a wacky question. Each of the other players must answer either the crazy truth or...a big fat lie! Will the liars prove convincing enough? Will Gullible succeed in uncovering all of them without pointing out the right answer?

—description from the publisher

You rub your eyes and look around. It's cold and dark. Where are you? You quickly realize that you have appeared in the zoo at night! Walking in the crisp snow, you recognize the entrance with its polar bears, the lake and the big rock, but the animals are nowhere to be seen. Instead, you meet a variety of different creatures. One of them turns to you to ask for your help. You must carry out a mission for which you are given a map showing a part of the zoo in detail. Based on this, and going via certain points in the zoo, you need to reach the final stage of your mission. The task seems easy, but the strange creatures that pop up and the blizzard howling around you make it difficult to navigate. Fortunately, if you listen carefully and manage to memorise all the stops on your journey, you can succeed in your mission. Meanwhile, the others are also wandering around the zoo. Which of you will achieve your goal first?

La détanque is a game of pétanque, dice and square balls at the same time!

It's the same principle as pétanque, you throw the cochodé (the jack dice) and then each team tries to position their dice as close as possible to the cochodé.

Where détanque brings an additional playful aspect is that one side of each of the dice represents a super power. Swap the place of a dice, multiply the points by two or divide them ... We are not at the end of our surprises!

Added to this are the different sides of the cochodé which can make you play a whole game on one foot, throwing with 2 hands or throwing with your left hand if you are right-handed and vice versa ... A lot of fun!

The first team to reach 30 points win

La détanque mini weighs about 700 g with 43mm diameter dice and easier to carry around or play inside.
La détanque weighs about 3.5 kg with 75mm diameter dice and let you play outside

Encore can be played 1v.1, 4v.4, 2v.7 or even solo. Will you be the cool and determined team blaze or energetic and speedy team lightning? Draw from the center action card pile and your own time card pile to begin the game. As you do your workout hand, the other team rests, but watch out! If you are caught resting after the other team has finished their round, you get to go overtime.

Every game you play is a different workout, sit-ups for 60 seconds and then burpees for 90 anyone? Probably not, but in that case you can always take your chances by drawing a wild card. By adding or taking out different amounts of time cards and workout cards, you can customize your difficulty level. You can also decide to start adding victory cards before or after the 8 minute mark to change the level of challenge. Various game modes from True Victor to Team Relay are also included in the instruction manual.

Once a team’s total time cards add up to 8 minutes, a victory card is shuffled into the time card pile. Now they have the chance to win!  For every consecutive minute, another victory card is added to the time card pile until one team draws a victory card. This team is the winner!

ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒãƒ»ã‚·ãƒ“ã‚¿ã‚¹ã®ã‚ã‚‹ãã‹ãŸ (Aruba Shibitasu no Arukikata) (How to walk Alba Civitas) is a game from Japan. Players are travelling around the city of Aruba at night, seeking hidden treasures. They meet local residents, find tools and clues that help them unearth the treasures.

A mixture of memo and actions, the city is a layout of face-down cards. On their turn, a player may move around and flip two cards, and memorise them. The cards have various conditions, and if a player satisfies the conditions, they get to keep the card or cards. These then help them further in their quest. By memorising the locations as all players reveal them, players race to complete the tasks and catch the most treasure to win.
user summary

Compete as Inn Keepers working to fill your Inn with the most guests by winning tricks and placing cards in sequential order on to your board. Earn extra points by offering amenities customers want. Split points for referring guests when you don’t have what they want and for fulfilling your bonus card goals. The Inn Keeper with the most points at the end is the winner!

-description from designer

The crazy card game to give every party an extra boost! To the left?! Or to the right ?! You can go in any direction in this card game! Roll the die and strategically discard your cards to earn as many ties as possible. Or don't those ties excite you and would you rather see your friends doing crazy dances, riding on each other's backs and walking the polonaise? Create your own game by adding the party cards and take on crazy physical challenges. Or do you really want to remove all limits and do you want to "drink, lick and dance"? Then add the 18+ cards! Snollebollekes - The card game is for all people who love a damn good party!

—description from the publisher

Tower Of Pancakes!! (ã‚¿ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒ‘ãƒ³ã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚¹â€¼) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

Cute cats love pancakes! Bake pancakes well, serve them, and aim to become the best-selling pancake maker!

There are 4 cats (A to D) waiting to be served pancakes. If they get more than 8 pancakes in a stack, the surplus becomes negative points. Except cat D, who is a glutton, and just makes more stacks of pancakes.

The players have chips of batter which are turned into cooked pancakes. The game follows standard trick-taking rules. The 1st & 2nd winners of the trick supply pancakes to the cats. The loser of the trick cooks their batter into pancakes according to the card they played.

When the tricks are played out, a final score is calculated based upon where players placed their cooked pancakes, minus penalties for over-supply.

The game has two variants in the rules; one for a different style of hand management, and one for an extreme supply of pancakes.
user summary

This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2019/2020 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.

In Maestro Leonardo's workshop, there are many apprentices who try to earn the master’s esteem. You too can participate in the creation of the greatest works of this genius of the Renaissance, painting or completing paintings shared with the group, becoming an expert in colors, and attracting the attention of the master with your achievements. Who will eventually become his pupil?

1. Take color cards from the table.
2. Use them to paint paintings and score points.
3. Score bonus points with Masteries and Achievement cards!

—description from the publisher

The firewall is down, but they know you got in. Now, it's a race to grab the most valuable information as the network shuts down around you. But be wary of the other hackers, as it's just as easy to steal from each other as from the system.

We’re In is a small route-planning game for 2 to 4 players. Each player controls an avatar moving around an ever-shrinking grid of tiles representing a nodes on company’s network, such as email servers or security cameras. When you move onto a tile, you hack the node to extract a token of information secretly worth 1, 2 or 3 points. Once all of the company’s secrets have been looted, you steal from each other instead.

With each move, tiles are tagged for suspicious activity and eventually shutdown, leaving gaps in the network and limiting your movement. When you move onto an occupied node, you are forced to share information with those players, surrendering your hard-won tokens. Your spoils are only secure after you logout of the system, either by running out of possible moves or waiting until the network gets small enough to slip out. Once everyone has logged out, the winner is the player with the most valuable set of tokens.

—description from the designer

Spell like you and your friend's lives depended on it! Action verbs can hurt or escape the zombie, can help your friends... or not! Pick up a shotgun and spell "shoot" to blow the zombie's head off! Strengthen your spelling skills while exercising strategic thinking in this cooperative and competitive game of survival. Can you make it out alive?

—description from the publisher

The stop-motion short film Dogonauts: Enemy Line introduces the Dogonauts universe. The card game Dogonauts: Starflea Territories continues from the film and pits players against one another to see who can repair their space ship first. Area control is the name of this game! Two versions of Dober the space dog and Fester the space flea can be chosen to deploy your battlefield tactics.

—description from the publisher

This is a VERY playable (free to print off and play) aerial transportation solitaire game about the U.S. Army Air Force's effort to fly supplies to China to keep it in World War 2 and tie up so many Imperial Japanese Army soldiers on the Asian mainland which it did.  http://www.CoatneyHistory.com/CBIATC.htm

(In the "Advanced" game, one player can be the Equipment transporter and the other the Fuel Transporter and separate record/chits could be kept to see if they achieve their respective delivery requirements.  Of course, if either fails too often, they both lose overall, so .... :-) )

The player chooses either the H (High Himalayas) route with its hazards or the M (Japanese fighter-interceptor aerodrome at Myitkina) route.  He takes the maximum number of transport aircraft pieces possible and then adds to that upside-down piece mix a number of hazard pieces equal to half the number of transports rounded up.

(In 1942-43, trying to fly the lower route over Myitkina is very much pushing your luck, depending on Japanese fighter strength and who wins the air battle.)

From that inverted total he pulls a number of pieces equal to the number of original transports and finds out if sufficient loads - DC3s/C-47s carry 1, C-46s and (B-24 Liberator transport) C-87s carry 2 (although the C-87s can only carry 1 over the High route), and the late war DC-4s/C-54s carry *4*! - make it over the Hump.

Of course, the number of loads required each season increases with the Allied supreme commanders' demands.

The USAAF Air Transport Command actually delivered far more supplies in the air than could be delivered by gas-guzzling trucks on the Burma and then Ledo/Stilwell Roads.

Hazards include Engine Failure, Unexpected Mountain, Mule Stampede! (wrecking the center of gravity ... 3,000 mules were delivered, 4 to a plane), Spontaneous Explosion (C-46s only), Bad Compass-Thick Clouds-Out of Gas, Oxygen Loss-Disorientation, and Rock Throwing Yetis! (Some planes just disappeared along the costly "Aluminum Highway." Wrecks and remains are still being found.)

The no-dice Basic Game plays in about 40 minutes max. and really gives you the overall sense of the air transport campaign.  (Ernest K. Gann was an ATC pilot and later wrote the book Fate is the Hunter.  The movie is free to watch on YouTube.)

The Advanced Game, differentiating Fuel and Equipment loads,  including sea and rail transport cargo capacities to the East India airfields, and having abstracted ground combat rules takes longer.

All aircraft icons are by me, pixel by pixel (hence, the small datafile size of the counter sheet).

The Dedication includes mention of one Bob Coatney, who was a master sergeant based at ATC headquarters in Dacca, East India.

—description from the designer

Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Cache Cat battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Giga Girl battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Cooperate to create a secret garden together, or compete to earn the most points in this double-sided adventure that includes a game and a puzzle. This experience is designed to be relaxing while you enjoy the simple act of putting puzzle pieces together, or lining up elements of a garden for more points. Play cooperatively or competitively with friends and family as peaceful calm surrounds you.

—description from the publisher

Polar Rails is a Christmas-themed game that uses the gameplay from Empire Builder with players creating rail networks that are centered on the North Pole.

Use your initial investment to build track, then pick up commodities where they are grown, mined, or manufactured and deliver them to a lucrative place of demand. Complete a delivery and make the money you need to buy larger, faster trains and expand your railroad empire. Win the game by building the most effective railroad empire!

In more detail, players use washable crayons to draw their train routes over a map of the North Pole, including North America, Greenland, Asia, and Europe. Players start with an initial sum of money which they use to build short lengths of track during their first couple of turns. For the rest of the game, players operate their trains over the track network drawn on the board to pick up and deliver loads to various cities, then have the opportunity to add to their track network or improve their train. The game uses demand cards which list three demands, each of a commodity to be delivered to a specified city for a given payoff. Each player has three demand cards to provide opportunities for income.

Each turn consists of an operations phase and a building phase. During the operations phase, trains are moved to cities where commodities are picked up at no cost and moved to one of the cities on that player's demand cards. When the commodity is delivered, the player receives the payoff and trades that demand card for a new one. Event cards are mixed in the deck with the demand cards. When an event card is drawn the instructions are followed. During the building phase, a player may pay to build more track or upgrade their train.

A player wins by being the first to connect their track network to six of the seven major cities on the board and acquire $250,000,000 in cash on hand.

Play the visceral, moment-to-moment game of American Football as a card game! Captures the essence of what it’s like to play Gridiron, without statistics, players, etc. You are the team and make the calls every play as you battle it out with the opposing team. Choose to be the home team or the visitor and it’s game on! Includes 56 cards depicting offensive and defensive actions (Run, Pass, Kick, Fake, Dive, Hail Mary, Hand-Off, Kickoff, Tackle, Fumble, etc.), 1 Offense card, 2 Score cards, 1 Reference card, and 3 Indicator cubes.

After the kickoff, the player assuming the role of offense will place a "Snap" card. The opponent can then place a card that counters or follows the snap card, such as "Tackle." Offense can counter with a "Pass." Cards can be played as combinations to increase your side's points. The goal is to get more points than your opponent every play to advance your marker on the score card. After 4 plays, offense will either score points (simulating a field goal all the way to a touchdown with a 2-point conversion) or defense will score 2 points for a safety. Play continues with the opponent assuming the role of offense.

All of this can be interrupted or changed if an opponent intercepts the ball, recovers a fumble, etc. And every action played has counters. Winning players have a little luck but play their cards strategically to maximize when to play combos, which cards to play vs. keep, and how to predict their opponent's plays. To add further depth, each card has an Offense and a Defense side to it, providing for many more play possibilities.

The deck represents either a full game, a half, or a quarter of a game. Once a full game is complete, whoever has the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

"Voi, Bravi ed Infelici: Tolentino 1815" is a wargame about the Napoleonic battle of Tolentino in 1815, the decisive episode of the Austro-Neapolitan war fought by the King of Naples, Gioacchino Murat, against the Austrians led by General Federico Bianchi. This battle saw the definitive Austrian victory, with the consequent return of the Bourbons to the Neapolitan throne and is considered by some historians as the first battle of the Italian Risorgimento.

Published in italian board-wargaming magazine "ParaBellum", issue VIII.

When Alexander the Great died in 323 BC, he left no clear heir to the immense empire he had conquered. It was not long after his death that the Macedonian generals began to war among themselves over who would be the regent or successor to Alexander's empire. 
By 305 BC they had given up on succession and began to carve out their own kingdoms.

Successors is a 2-5 player card-driven wargame based on those wars.

Successors was first published in 1997 by Avalon Hill. 
Some years later a second edition rulebook was published that gave more options for the Tyche cards. 
Then Successors III, built on the foundation of the Successors II rules set plus expansion cards, appeared in the Boardgamer.

The fourth edition of Successors includes more generals, more scenarios, new Tyche cards, plenty of new components, and a changed map, with Libya and Cyrene being merged.

The night is still young and the Party community starts off to find the best Party in town. For now the streets are full of people but soon the vibe will rise on the dance floors. Who is the host making the most money out of his guests? Who throws the coolest Party? And which Party will end in a brawl?

Dice Party is a dice game for 2-4 players in which every player acts as a party host, throwing a party that competes with the parties of the other players. Each player has up to 60 dice to throw, representing party guests of three types: cool Party People (yellow), high society VIPs (orange) and experience-driven rowdys, referred to as Mob (red).

While each round is a tactical challenge, since you have three different win conditions to outreach your opponents, the game unfolds its strategic depth with its Party Animal mode. Playing this full mode you're playing multiple rounds, trying to achieve complete victory by winning once with each of the 3 victory conditions:

     All other Partys escalate due to their Mob guests.
     A VIP millionaire hits your Party.
     You pickpocket six wallets from your Party People.

Once a year, all family members of the notorious Azzardo family meet in the warehouse of the "Tutti Frutti" seafood restaurant to divide up the stolen goods according to an old family tradition. Everyone can try their luck, but only one will leave the meeting with a full suitcase. Who will prove to be the most skillful player in the hot-blooded game of gamblers, skillfully challenging luck and risk?

At the start of each round in Family Inc., if you have face-up chips in front of you, you score them, advancing your counter on the score board, then removing those chips from the game. Next, you reveal one new chip after another from the middle of the table, placing them face up in front of you.

After each new chip, you decide whether to reveal more chips or whether to end your turn. If you reveal a new chip during your turn that matches one of your face-up chips, your turn ends, collecting only a diamond in compensation if your turn ended after your second or third chip reveal. (If you collect a third diamond, return all your diamonds and score 50 points.) When you end your turn voluntarily, collect all face-up chips from in front of other players that match the values of your chips.

When a player reaches the 100 space on the score track, the game ends and this player wins.

Play any of five new mathematical games with this double-sided deck that commemorates the 50th anniversary of the Association for Women in Mathematics! EvenQuads games use symbols representing four major mathematical organizations and EvenBetter games use the flip sides featuring amazing women mathematicians.

All five games are mathematical.  EvenQuads games challenge your  matching speed as you collect Quads, as solitaire, with friends or in a  rummy version.  EvenBetter games help you learn about the featured  women. All five games are specially designed to accommodate our unique double-sided cards.

Deck 1 (of 4) of EvenQuads includes 64 cards, and an insert with instructions in both English y Español, and a description of the EvenQuads mathematics.

Four big pawns represent the parents, the family dog and the house keeper, while the six small pawns represent the kids (the Brady Bunch). The goal of the game is for the adults and the dog to find the kids and take them home to score points.

If up to 4 players are playing the players represent the adults and the dog, while the kids are moved only according to the game rules. If more than 4 players are playing, the kids are also moved by players.

—user summary

In this party game for adults, TEN luminaries of humor take you into their comedic world with around thirty cards each, written in their beautiful, gentle and perfect hands. 
So you have 300 new, really funny and salty cards that you can play on your own or add to your big game collection.

The game play remains the same:

     La Grande Yeule reads a black card. 
     All other players choose a red card from their hand that would fill the |… |. 
     La Grande Yeule then chooses her/his favorite red card and the player who placed it wins the black card.


Also, as a bonus, this game contains the L'osti d'jeu: FranÃ§ois PÃ©russe.

—description (translated) from the publisher

LG TACTICS is a strategy-lite battle card game where you must outmaneuver your opponents to win. It features simple gameplay where you decide which cards to deploy and attack with.

The game is played with a single deck of cards and you can learn the rules in minutes. Players need to Recruit, Deploy and Attack with their cards until only one army remains. You can play against one or more opponent, or even play solo to test your skills. Games take about 15 minutes per person, and 1 - 5 people can play (more if you combine 2 decks).

Game cards feature a single number representing its power level. Some powerful cards have a deploy requirement in order to play onto the battlefield.

TACTICS comes with 72 cards and rule book in a game box. Cards feature original illustrations in a minimal fantasy silhouette style.

—description from the publisher

In the game, players will climb the Babia Góra, observing nature. Taking cards from the common pot allows you to build another level of the mountain and the pawn shows the place of our climbing. The card can be used in three ways: as a part of the mountain, as an element of nature or as an equipment. In order to enter the next cards it is necessary to have the appropriate equipment. Players earn points for the cards they have visited and sets of nature cards (animals, plants). The player with the most points wins.

ONE is a simple strategy game for 2-6 players.

Your goal is to form the largest group of connected stones. Capture opponents' stones to block their expansion and add points to your score. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher
